title-group.article-title: The Pediatric Cell Atlas: defining the growth phase of human development at single-cell resolution

license.license-p: Open-access paper published in Developmental Cell at https://doi.org/10.1016/j.devcel.2019.03.001

abstract.p: Single-cell gene expression analyses of mammalian tissues have uncovered profound stage-specific molecular regulatory phenomena that have changed the understanding of unique cell types and signaling pathways critical for lineage determination, morphogenesis, and growth. We discuss here the case for a Pediatric Cell Atlas as part of the Human Cell Atlas consortium to provide single-cell profiles and spatial characterization of gene expression across human tissues and organs. Such data will complement adult and developmentally focused HCA projects to provide a rich cytogenomic framework for understanding not only pediatric health and disease but also environmental and genetic impacts across the human lifespan.
